#Text=Illustrations
#Text=“ Buffalo Bill took me on Soldier Boy to Frontispiece Thunder-Bird ’s Camp ”
#Text=“ Look at that file of cats in your chair ” p. 48 “ Every morning they go clattering down into the 66 plain ”
#Text=“ There was nothing to do but stand by ” 92 “ His strength failed and he fell at her feet ” 150
#Text=Acknowledgements
#Text=Although I have had several opportunities to see a bull-fight , I have never seen one ; but I needed a bull-fight in this book , and a trustworthy one will be found in it .
#Text=I got it out of John Hay ’s Castilian Days , reducing and condensing it to fit the requirements of this small story .
#Text=Mr. Hay and I were friends from early times , and if he were still with us he would not rebuke me for the liberty I have taken .

#Text=The knowledge of military minutiæ exhibited in this book will be found to be correct , but it is not mine ; I took it from Army Regulations , ed . 1904 ; Hardy ’s Tactics — Cavalry , revised ed . , 1861 ; and Jomini ’s Handbook of Military Etiquette , West Point ed . , 1905 .
#Text=It would not be honest in me to encourage by silence the inference that I composed the Horse ’s private bugle-call , for I did not .
#Text=I lifted it , as Aristotle says .
#Text=It is the opening strain in The Pizzicato in Sylvia , by Delibes .
#Text=When that master was composing it he did not know it was a bugle-call , it was I that found it out .
#Text=Along through the book I have distributed a few anachronisms and unborn historical incidents and such things , so as to help the tale over the difficult places .
#Text=This idea is not original with me ;
#Text=I got it out of Herodotus .
#Text=Herodotus says ,
#Text=“ Very few things happen at the right time , and the rest do not happen at all : the conscientious historian will correct these defects . ”
#Text=The cats in the chair do not belong to me , but to another .
#Text=These are all the exceptions .
#Text=What is left of the book is mine .
#Text=MARK TWAIN .
#Text=LONE TREE HILL , DUBLIN , NEW HAMPSHIRE , October , 1905 .
#Text=Part I
#Text=I SOLDIER BOY — PRIVATELY TO HIMSELF
#Text=I AM Buffalo Bill ’s horse .

#Text=I have spent my life under his saddle — with him in it , too , and he is good for two hundred pounds , without his clothes ; and there is no telling how much he does weigh when he is out on the war-path and has his batteries belted on .

#Text=He is over six feet , is young , has n’t an ounce of waste flesh , is straight , graceful , springy in his motions , quick as a cat , and has a handsome face , and black hair dangling down on his shoulders , and is beautiful to look at ; and nobody is braver than he is , and nobody is stronger , except myself .

#Text=Yes , a person that doubts that he is fine to see should see him in his beaded buck-skins , on my back and his rifle peeping above his shoulder , chasing a hostile trail , with me going like the wind and his hair streaming out behind from the shelter of his broad slouch .
#Text=Yes , he is a sight to look at then — and I ’m part of it myself .
#Text=I am his favorite horse , out of dozens .
#Text=Big as he is , I have carried him eighty-one miles between nightfall and sunrise on the scout ; and I am good for fifty , day in and day out , and all the time .
#Text=I am not large , but I am built on a business basis .

#Text=I have carried him thousands and thousands of miles on scout duty for the army , and there ’s not a gorge , nor a pass , nor a valley , nor a fort , nor a trading post , nor a buffalo-range in the whole sweep of the Rocky Mountains and the Great Plains that we do n’t know as well as we know the bugle-calls .
#Text=He is Chief of Scouts to the Army of the Frontier , and it makes us very important .
#Text=In such a position as I hold in the military service one needs to be of good family and possess an education much above the common to be worthy of the place .
#Text=I am the best-educated horse outside of the hippodrome , everybody says , and the best-mannered .
#Text=It may be so , it is not for me to say ; modesty is the best policy , I think .
#Text=Buffalo Bill taught me the most of what I know , my mother taught me much , and I taught myself the rest .

#Text=Lay a row of moccasins before me — Pawnee , Sioux , Shoshone , Cheyenne , Blackfoot , and as many other tribes as you please — and I can name the tribe every moccasin belongs to by the make of it .
#Text=Name it in horse-talk , and could do it in American if I had speech .
